title: Glasgow Boys Brigade (86th)
content: The 86th Glasgow Boys Brigade run a local toy reuse and recycling project in Glasgow.

title: A Greener Melrose
content: A Greener Melrose aims to protect, conserve and improve their local environment, promote sustainable developments, increase resilience to resource scarcity and establish a local Transition Initiative.

title: Accessible Tennis
content: Accessible Tennis advocates sustainability by providing tennis coaching in different venues across Scotland for underrepresented groups and lobbying for a reuse tennis equipment scheme.

title: Acharacle Community Company
content: Acharacle Community Company runs a waste reduction and reuse project and is always on the lookout for good quality donations.

title: Alloa Community Enterprises
content: Alloa Community Enterprises is Clackmannanshire's largest reuse furniture and bric-a-brac outlet.

title: Angus Cycle Hub
content: Angus Cycle Hub is dedicated to supporting and developing cycling across Angus with a number of projects, including the repair and sale of reuse bikes.

title: Arran Eco Savvy
content: Arran Eco Savvy aim for a happy thriving community living and working sustainably, with clean air, zero waste and an unspoilt, unpolluted beautiful environment; enriched with a healthy wildlife, flora & fauna on the Isle of Arran.

title: Babes In The Wood
content: Babes In The Wood reuse items to reduce the environmental impact of landfill waste. Their community shop in Stirling offers the sale of high quality, safety checked children's goods at low prices for local families.

title: Barra and Vatersay Environmental Services Ltd
content: Barra & Vatersay Waste Management offer community recycling services to promote greater recycling opportunities for their islands' communities.

title: Beairteas Bharraigh Ltd
content: Beairteas Bharraigh aims to increase sustainability and promote and improve local skills in traditional activities such as growing, gardening, upcycling, cooking, crofting, fishing, spinning, knitting, crochet and other crafts in an inclusive, accessible and affordable manner thus upskilling the local community as well as providing learning opportunities for visitors to the area.

title: Belhelvie Community Trust
content: Belhelvie Community Trust is a Development Trust to support the community who have come together to explore how to do more community focussed environment projects.

title: Bethany Christian Trust
content: Bethany Christian Trust is an Edinburgh-based charity for homelessness that accepts donations of furniture, household and electrical goods through it's charity shops in and around Edinburgh.

title: Bike for Good Glasgow West
content:
Bike for Good are based in Glasgow.

Our Vision is an environment where everyone benefits from riding a bicycle, and our Mission is to enable people in Scotland to cycle as their mode of transport.

We refurbish, repair and teach communities how to maintain a bicycles, improve the environment, teach skills, and improve mental and physical health.

title: Blythswood Care
content: Blythswood Care deliver reuse and recycling services across Scotland through their network of charity shops, committed to the environment, it is a Christian organisation primarily dedicated to providing humanitarian aid, disaster relief and social care projects to people who need it in Europe, Africa and Asia.

title: British Heart Foundation
content: Do you need a new sofa or bed? Fancy a new look in your dining room? Our Furniture & Electrical stores sell quality items at great prices. Why not stop by your local store today and find a bargain?

title: Carthannas Nis
content: Carthannas Nis is a community charity shop in the village of Cross on Lewis in the Western Isles accepting donations of clothes, furniture and household goods from around the island.

title: Castle Furniture Project
content: Castle Furniture Project takes donations of good quality furniture, household items, toys, electrical appliances, white goods from throughout Fife and sell them in their reuse stores in Cupar and Glenrothes.

title: CFINE
content:
Community Food initiatives North East (CFINE) is a successful charity and social enterprise providing a quality service to thousands of individuals in NE Scotland across food supply, fareshare, circular economy and employability projects.

They are working in collaboration with XS Resources CIC to collect unwanted but working IT and small electrical equipment. All donated equipment will get refurbished and resold. CFINE are able to accept donations of working IT Equipment and small appliances on Wednesday’s and Friday’s between 11 – 1pm.

title: Changeworks
content: We are Scotlands leading environmental charity delivering solutions for low carbon living. A trusted expert with over 30 years experience.

title: Coll Recycling Group
content: Recycoll are an environmental group based on the Hebridean island of Coll and undertake a range of recycling, reuse, composting and environmental projects.

title: COPE Ltd
content: COPE Ltd is a successful social enterprise, based in Shetland, providing employment and skill development for adults with learning disabilities or autism spectrum disorders across reuse, garden, catering and soap-making projects.

title: Cothrom Ltd
content: Cothrom Ltd accepts donations of good-quality furniture from homes and offices around South Uist and sells them at its Re-Store in Bornish, South Uist.

title: Cunninghame Furniture Recycling Company
content: Cunninghame Furniture Recycling is an Ayrshire based social enterprise providing low-cost, second-hand furniture and household items to those on low incomes, and offers a number of training, employment and volunteer opportunities to local people.

title: Dundee Starter Packs SCIO
content: Starter Packs Dundee accept donations of various household essentials such as towels, bedding, pots and pans, cleaning products, toiletries and more. These are then made into starter packs for previously homeless individuals moving into their first permanent tenancy – giving them the basics needed for a decent standard of living.

title: Earthtime For All
content: Earthtime is an award-winning, Moray-based charity connecting children and young people with the natural environment and the circular economy using creative and woodland based activities to improve self-esteem, health and well-being.

title: The Bike Station Edinburgh
content: The Bike Station Edinburgh's aim is to help people start and keep cycling and that begins with the bicycle. Their shop stocks everything you'll need to keep your bike in perfect condition. With the emphasis on old parts reclaimed from donated bikes, there is no cheaper way of looking after your bike whilst keeping waste out of landfill.

title: Edinburgh University
content: Edinburgh University Estates Team is responsible for all waste management, reuse and recycling services at the University.

title: Emmaus Glasgow
content: Emmaus Glasgow – the homeless charity that works. We believe that people who are homeless and socially excluded have something to offer. Their Glasgow-based charity shops provide low-cost, recycled second-hand furniture, white goods, bric-a-brac, clothing and more throughout the local community.

title: Falkirk Homeless Project
content: The Falkirk Homeless Project collects furniture and household goods, passing them on to homeless people who are taking up new tenancies but cant afford to furnish a home from scratch.

title: Falkland Centre for Stewardship
content: The Falkland Centre for Stewardship is about Realising the potential of people and place. They run a number of events throughout the year and we work with a range of partners, volunteers and Friends who are often as passionate about the stewardship of this place and the wider world in which we live as they are.

title: Forfar Resource Store
content: Forfar Resource Store are a community enterprise that accepts donations of three-piece suites, beds, white goods and other household furniture to sell in their shop. They also provide starter packs of furniture and household equipment for homeless people who have just taken up unfurnished tenancies.

title: Forth Environment Link
content: Forth Environment Link (FEL) is a Scottish environmental charity, based in the Forth Valley, leading the way on connecting people and place on actions which make a positive response to the Climate Emergency.  They support more day to day journeys on foot or by bike; encourage more local food to be grown and eaten in local communities; and help increase the lifespan of everyday items.

title: Forward Coupar Angus
content: Forward Coupar Angus is a Development Trust founded to improve the economic, environmental and social sustainability of the town of Coupar Angus and its immediate surrounding area. A town that strives to create opportunities for a better social and working environment, while at the same time aiming to fight climate change by reducing carbon dioxide emissions in the community.

title: Four Square
content: The Edinburgh Furniture Initiative is a reuse furniture project run by Foursquare; a charity that has been supporting thousands of homeless and other vulnerable people for more than 40 years.

title: Free For Fuel
content: Free For Fuel is a charity operating a reuse furniture shop in Catrine to reduce poverty and increase recycling, working with East Ayrshire Council.

title: Fresh Start (Scotland)
content: Fresh Start is an Edinburgh-based charity that helps people who have been homeless get established in their new home.  Through involving volunteers and organisations from a broad section of the community, Fresh Start delivers a range of services that provide essential household goods, practical and social support that helps people resettle successfully.

title: Furniture Plus Ltd
content: Furniture Plus is the largest furniture re-use, recycling and repair organisation in Fife. Our main aim is to combat poverty and social exclusion, especially homelessness, through our core business activity of re-using, recycling and repairing furniture and other household goods that may otherwise have gone to landfill, benefitting local communities, both socially and environmentally, whilst generating core income to sustain the project.

title: Furniture Recycling Project Angus
content: The Furniture Recycling Project Angus (FRPA) aims to relieve the poverty, need and distress of the inhabitants of Angus by promoting the re-use of furniture, household goods, domestic electrical appliances and other equipment. It provides services, training, support and development to individuals and communities to enable them to overcome disadvantage.

title: Fyne Futures
content: Fyne Futures provides a range of community projects to improve the environment and promote sustainability in and around Argyll and Bute including recycling, furniture reuse, local growing and education projects.

title: Glasgow Wood Recycling
content: Glasgow Wood Recycling is a social enterprise that collects wood waste from homes and businesses and makes it into a variety of, often unique, wood products that are sold for reasonable rates. It provides volunteering and training opportunities to local people in an effort to help combat poverty and social exclusion.

title: Gordon Rural Action
content: Gordon Rural Action is a charity that provides support on a range of social issues with the aim of improving the quality of life for individuals. They manage two reuse shops selling second-hand goods, including furniture, clothing and bric-a-brac, which are donated by the generous community.

title: Gorebridge Community Development Trust
content: The Greening Gorebridge project exists to bring people in the community together to connect with their surrounding environment, enabling transformation of simple things in our daily lives that tackle the challenges of climate change.

title: Govanhill Baths Community Trust
content: Rags to Riches, in Govanhill, Glasgow, designs and manufactures innovative upcycled products locally handcrafted in Govanhill. Our high quality range includes foot stools, furniture, homeware, bags, throws and much more.

title: Grampian Housing Association
content: Grampian is a leading housing association based in the North East of Scotland providing services to over 3,500 households. TLC Housing Maintenance (TLC) is also a subsidiary company and installs new kitchens and bathrooms in line with the Associations aim to improve and maintain standards in tenants homes.

title: Granton Hub
content: Granton:hub is a community hub in North Edinburgh where people can meet, participate, learn, create and enjoy a range of great activities. We offer a range of workshops and classes, including drawing, painting, printmaking and bookbinding; have a growing archive of materials and objects connected to the history of the local area; and are home to a community garden thats open for all to visit and enjoy.

title: Greener Kemnay
content:
The basic aim of Greener Kemnay is to be the green conscience of our Aberdeenshire village. Our purposes are:
The advancement of environmental protection; Promotion of the green agenda; Supporting access to the local path network; Sustainable energy and development; Supporting local growing opportunities and Promoting community composting schemes.

title: Greener Kirkcaldy
content: Greener Kirkcaldy is a community-led charity and development trust working on a local scale to benefit people and our environment. We deliver projects to meet the needs and aspirations of local people; tackling fuel and food poverty, protecting and enjoying the environment and bringing the community together.

title: Healthy n Happy Community Development Trust
content: Healthy n Happy Community Development Trust is an award winning charity and community owned organisation governed by local people, where all of our work is directed by local priorities for Cambuslang and Rutherglen. All of what we offer, including our successful Bike Town Project supports and enables people to make positive changes in their lives and their community.

title: Hebrides Alpha Trading CIC
content: Hebrides Alpha Trading helps individuals with addiction problems by providing therapeutic employment opportunities via its services to the public. These include an islands recycling service, managing textile banks and upcycling materials into bespoke products such as Harris Tweed Clocks.

title: Helping Us Get Greener
content: Helping Us Get Greener (HUGG) is an Aberdeenshire-based project for education support and development of recycling, reuse and repurposing of items that would normally end up in landfill. The aim is to build and open an education, recycling, reuse and repurposing centre in the Garioch/Formartine area.

title: Home Basics Tweeddale
content: Home Basics Tweeddale provides furniture, white goods and other household items to those most in need in the Scottish Borders. Surplus goods are sold to the public from its depots at Hawick and Walkerburn where donations of quality goods are also accepted.

title: Home from Home (Scotland) Ltd
content: Home from Home, a furniture reuse organisation based in Dunbarton, takes donations of unwanted furniture, white goods and other household goods. These are then provided free of charge or at low cost to people in West Dunbartonshire who are on low incomes.

title: HomeAid West Lothian
content: HomeAid West Lothian is a charity based in Bathgate providing a free/low cost furniture service to homeless and low income families and individuals in need throughout West Lothian. All proceeds from the sale of furniture in our shop is used to support our service to families and individuals in need in West Lothian.

title: ILM Highland
content: ILM Highland, based in Alness in Easter Ross runs a reuse and repair service for electrical equipment called Transform, and a consultancy service to help others set up recycling initiatives. From its Alness shop, on the Teaninich Industrial Estate, it sells refurbished cookers, fridges, washing machines and other electrical items.

title: Instant Neighbour
content:
Instant Neighbour is a local charity based in Aberdeen.
For 35 years we have provided food parcels to those most in need, along with advice and support.
Our shops provide good quality reuse furniture, white goods, clothing and bric a brac, enabling those on low incomes to set up home.
Our Social Enterprises, Joinerinc, Carpetinc and Removalinc are professional services available to everyone.

title: Just Cycle
content: Just Cycle is a Borders charity that has been set up with the aim of recycling and reusing bikes that would otherwise have been thrown out. Unused bikes are recovered from a range of sources, transported to our base at Tweedbank Craft Centre and then recycled and made available to the local community at an affordable price.

title: Kinning Park Complex
content: Kinning Park Complex is an independent, multi use community space in the Southside of Glasgow. ? We provide a variety of great activities in a place that brings people together, helps reduce isolation, builds friendships and creates a real sense of community.

title: Kintyre Recycling Ltd
content: Kintyre Recycling is an Argyll social enterprise providing a variety of recycling, reuse and environmental services to the Campbeltown and Kintyre area. They also run a busy furniture reuse project in Campbeltown which accepts donations of furniture, bikes and other household items.

title: LAMH Recycle Limited
content: LAMH Recycle Ltd is a Motherwell-based social enterprise whose main objective is our ‘social inclusion agenda which we address through the provision of employability development opportunities within our supportive workplace environment. Our business activities focus on waste management, recycling and reuse.

title: LEAP (Local Energy Action Plan)
content: LEAP deliver a wide range of free and impartial services in communities across Renfrewshire. We help increase climate literacy, save residents energy and money through our free impartial energy efficiency advice. We encourage sustainable community development  around areas such as energy, transport, waste reduction, active and shared transport.

title: Link Group Ltd
content: The LINK Group are a group of award-winning social enterprise companies serving more than 15,000 customers, making them one of the largest social landlords in Scotland.

title: Lochaber Environmental Group
content:
Lochaber Environmental Group are working to reduce carbon emissions and foster a sustainable future for the environment and communities of Lochaber; focusing on energy consumption, renewable energy, active travel, local food production and waste reduction.

They manage the Fort William Bike Kitchen Project - LEG is continuing to develop the Bike Kitchen to promote active travel in Lochaber and teach bike repair skills.

title: Luma-IT
content: Luma-IT specialises in IT consultancy, management and improvement for charities, social enterprises, community groups and voluntary organisations. We are the only fully-fledged social enterprise IT company in the country, whose sole purpose is to provide high quality, reliable and cost-effective IT systems to our fellow third sector organisations.

title: Magpie
content: Magpie is a not-for-profit second-hand furniture shop that exists to promote a more sustainable way of living, providing the Aberdeenshire community with the chance to reuse, recycle, upcycle and find a unique bargain As well as being a shop, Magpie helps those in need by donating furniture and household goods through partner agencies and we work with our local foodbank and criminal justice department too.

title: Make Do and Grow CIC
content: We are a not-for-profit social enterprise in Glasgow, focused on supporting growing families with children aged 3-12, developing creativity and encouraging re-use and recycle. We encourage creative development through our structured classes and free play sessions, using predominantly recyclable materials and in our retail unit, we also offer affordable, quality pre-loved and upcycled clothing and toys.

title: Midlothian Advice & Resource Centre
content: Midlothian Advice and Resource Centre (MARC) is a community based social enterprise that collects unwanted furniture and white goods and provides them to families in the community on low income at a reduced or no cost.  MARC has a community shop in Dalkeith where refurbished furniture and electrical equipment can be purchased. As a social enterprise, MARC also provides employment and volunteer opportunities to people in the community.

title: Mixer CIC
content: Miixer CIC is a social enterprise based in East Lothian foccusing on reuse and keeping good things in local circulation, rather than landfill. From our shop in Dunbar we sell quality items cheaply to our local communities, donate to local groups and charities, and support those in need with free goods. Our clothing initiative Big Pick aims to eradicate clothing poverty in our area.

title: Moray Waste Busters
content: Moray Waste Busters runs a reuse hub in Forres next to the recycling centre where donations of furniture, household goods, bikes and garden items can also be made. We also promote awareness about reuse and recycling through an education programme for schools and other groups and provides volunteer placement opportunities.

title: Move On
content: Move On supports homeless people and vulnerable young people through training and employability programmes on various projects: Move On Wood Recycling is a social enterprise in Edinburgh which collects waste wood, sells quality timber and provides volunteering, training and work experience opportunities. Move On also delivers the Fareshare Programme in Glasgow.

title: Mull and Iona Community Trust
content: Mull & Iona Community Trust run the Mull & Iona Environmentally Sensitive Solutions (MESS) Project which delivers recycling services across the islands and two reuse furniture & charity shops.

title: Nairn River Enterprise
content: Green Hive in Nairn is a community hub supporting local people to design solutions with a focus on environmental challenges and empowering them to deliver a wide range of activities, products and services which benefit the people and places of Nairnshire.

title: Neilston Development Trust
content: Neilston Development Trust is a charity serving the residents of Neilston, helping them build on their strengths and create a sustainable future for their place. With a strong local membership, and an ambitious delivery programme, including a Bike Reuse Project we are committed to the physical, social and economic renewal and sustainability of Neilston.

title: Networks of Wellbeing
content: Networks of Wellbeing is a diverse charity that promotes and supports people in improving their mental health and wellbeing in Huntly. They run a Bike Shack Project a non-profit making bike recycling initiative.

title: New Start Highland
content: New Start Highlands mission is to tackle poverty, homelessness and long term unemployment in the Highlands. Our work creates social and environmental improvements within our local community through supporting people, delivering training opportunities and promoting re-use.

title: Open Gates
content: Open Gates will support prisoners and ex-prisoners through an employment and training programme with the aim of reducing re-offending and stopping the revolving door back into prison. Individuals who have managed to break the cycle will use their experience to mentor and support other offenders to do the same. Operating as a social enterprise, the organisation will manufacture, recycle, and upcycle furniture and white goods and sell to the general public.

title: Orkney Zero Waste
content: Orkney Zero Waste is a source of knowledge and information on waste reduction and recycling in the Orkney Isles. It operates recycling collections, which uplift paper and card from local businesses for recycling, and works with local businesses, industries and retailers to reduce waste production at source.

title: Perth Community Farm
content: Perth Community Farm is going to achieve exactly what it says in the name it's going to be created for the people of Perth to bring like minded public back together in a hub where we all have something in common. As well as a busy community growing space we have opened a zero waste shop in Perth.

title: Pretty Unique Boutique CIC
address: Badenheath Place, Cumbernauld, Glasgow G68 9HX, UK
content: Pretty Unique Boutique is a Community Interest Company (CIC) promoting arts and craft activities in the Chryston area and we have vintage, pre-loved and craft made items for sale to encourage recycling and reusing in our public shop.

title: PUSH
content: PUSH are Perth-based and provide supported employment experiences and further explore future options for their clients. Their aim is to enable people with additional support needs who are in the transition stage to be more informed about their working future. They run a recycling and reuse project, including two reuse retail units.

title: R:evolve Recycle
content: The R:evolve Recycle project aims to reduce textiles waste by delivering services which help people to think differently about their clothes.   We currently operate three swap shop boutiques in Cambuslang, Hamilton and Rutherglen as well as intergenerational childrens education programme, weekly ‘make-do-and-mend workshops for adults and a clothing bank for people living in poverty.

title: RAMH
content: RAMH is a charity in the mental health field providing information and services within a framework of recovery and support, which we see as essential to reinforce hope, respect and equality. The RAMH Reuse Superstore in Johnstone is a social enterprise, recycling and upcycling donated furniture, vintage, collectables and textiles. All profits go straight back into mental health services for local people.

title: Re:Craft Glasgow CIC
content: Re:Craft is an arts and crafts materials reuse and recycling shop. We accept donations of second hand, part used arts and crafts materials. We also take dry recycling items such as wine corks, cardboard tubes, tin cans etc. which we resell at reasonable prices with the primary aim of keeping as much out of landfill as possible. We have beads, books and magazines, fabric and yarn, paint, card, buttons and thread, in fact anything and everything crafty!

title: ReBOOT
content: ReBOOT is a social enterprise, based in Forres that specialises in Computer and IT repair, reuse and recycling services. Any computer equipment that cannot be refurbished is disassembled, reduced to base components, then recycled in accordance with current SEPA regulations.

title: RECAP (N.Lanarkshire)
content: RECAP is a furniture and white good recycling project based in Cumbernauld. It collects, refurbishes and redistributes household goods within the local community, selling goods at low cost to the local community. RECAP also provides employment and volunteering opportunities in the communities it serves.

title: ReConnect Glasgow
content: ReConnect Glasgow has a vision to support local residents in the East End of Glasgow, as well as embody a reuse culture that helps save the planet. We aim to make sure as many items of furniture as possible are saved from landfill and sell them on through our shop to the people who need it the most. Everything we sell is high quality at bargain prices.

title: Recycle Mobility Centre
content: Recycle Mobility Centre offers a quality service that refurbishes, maintains, and repairs all types of mobility equipment to the highest standard and sells it used / second hand at an affordable price to those who can least afford to buy new equipment. We also offer volunteers a workplace opportunity and training that meets their specific needs including placing young people in mechanical engineering roles giving them their first chance to gain work experience and pursue a career in engineering and other maintenance vocations.

title: Recycling First Project
content: Recycling First assist individual families throughout East Lothian who are in receipt of benefits to access necessary household furniture and collect good quality second hand furniture to distribute to disadvantaged families.

title: Recyke-a-Bike
content: Recyke-a-bike is a Stirling social enterprise that delivers bike recycling, reuse, training services and outreach work as well as a community café. Our aims are to help people, our local community and environment by: Supporting people into employment, education, training and volunteering: Helping more people to choose cycling for low carbon transport: Improving better health and wellbeing: Stopping bikes ending up in landfill: and of course for fun.

title: Remake Scotland
content: Remake Scotland is a Revolve certified community reuse charity based in Crieff promoting environmental sustainability across Perth and Kinross.

title: Repair Café Glasgow
content: Repair Cafe Glasgow is a voluntary organisation, founded in 2017 on the principles of Repair Café International, and built upon the idea that our possessions have lots of life left in them when we maintain and repair them. Doing this together with others builds social cohesion and combats isolation, while helping reduce the size of our landfills.

title: Repairel Hub
content: REPAIREL is a new social enterprise that aims to set up an environmentally conscious Shoe (self)Repair Hub in the North West of Glasgow that will help people break away from the throwaway culture and Do apparel responsibly.

title: Scottish Borders Social Enterprise Chamber
content: The Scottish Borders Social Enterprise Chamber provides a collective voice and focal point for the development of social enterprise in the Scottish Borders, offering a variety of services to help our members develop and grow.

title: SeAscape
content: The name Seascape (South Ayrshire Escape from Homelessness) is synonymous with the relief of poverty and homelessness in South Ayrshire. Established in 1999 we began delivering support to the homeless community and those at risk of homelessness through our Rent Deposit Guarantee System and since that time has helped thousands of people with housing and poverty issues. Since 2012, Seascape has also been providing housing support services on behalf of South Ayrshire Council.

title: Second Opportunities
content: Our Furniture Reuse and White Goods Re-use Centre is open to the public acting as an attractive and popular pre-loved second hand furniture retail space, sales from which help generate much needed income used to subsidise support to service users who are referred from our network of support agencies.  Visitors will find a wide variety of competitively priced pre-loved furniture and white goods aimed at meeting all the household needs and which help turn a house into a home.

title: SHAX
content: SHAX is a Charity serving the Dumfries area, receiving donations of household goods, furniture, white goods, electrical items, linen and clothing which are reused to supply minimal cost crisis need used furniture and white goods to people in Dumfries and the surrounding areas. The SHAX charity furniture warehouse is also open to the public.

title: SHRUB Co-Op
content: Were a cooperative in Edinburgh working for a world without waste! We empower our community to live a low carbon life. Become a member and learn to fix a bike, swap your preloved things, enjoy some rescued food and be inspired by new ideas.

title: Society Zero
content: Society Zero run Glasgow's Zero Waste Shop & Social Enterprise. Start your journey to zero waste here. We provide environmentally friendly and ethically sound products to reduce the amount of single use products and unnecessary waste filling up landfill to fulfil our aims as a zero waste company. Any packaging or products we use to ship your products are reused and recycled packaging.

title: Somebody Cares SCIO
content: Somebody Cares is the leading organisation in Aberdeen and Aberdeenshire providing free food, furniture, clothing and much more to the poor, the vulnerable and the marginalised people of the area.

title: Something Old Something New
content: Something Old Something New (SOSN) is a furniture reuse project based in Stirling. It manages a retail outlet for upcycled and second hand goods in order to raise funds for Parkinsons Disease research.

title: SoulRiders Scotland
content: Soulriders vision is to create a stronger, healthier, more active community through cycling. As a true community-led organisation our people come from all walks of life and from our Cycling Centre in the south-side of Glasgow we refurbish donated bikes that can then be given back to the community, carry out repairs on both members and the public bikes and offer mechanical training.

title: South Seeds
content: South Seeds is a community organisation based in the South Central area of Glasgow. We aim to work in partnership with residents and organisations within the local community to help improve the look and feel of the area. Under the climate challenge fund South Seeds is further developing the project to increase energy awareness and helping people learn more about growing food and reducing the amount of waste that we produce.

title: Spruce Carpets
content: Spruce Carpets are a social enterprise that offers high quality end of roll/surplus carpets and vinyl as well as new carpets and vinyl. We provide training and work experience opportunities for people who have found themselves excluded from the job market.

title: St Patricks Furniture Project
content: St. Patricks Furniture Project in Shotts, Lanarkshire, provides a low cost furniture reuse service to help people on low incomes purchase furniture and white goods at low cost, helping them sustain their tenancies.

title: Starter Packs Glasgow - Magpie's Eye Reuse Store
content: Starter Packs Glasgow is a charity based in Govan working to alleviate poverty across the city. By providing packs of essential household goods to those moving into a new tenancy, often after homelessness, we can make houses more homely, and help people to sustain their tenancy. We do this through the help and support of our local community, much-needed donations and the many staff and volunteers were lucky to work with.

title: Stella's Voice
content: Stella's Voice are a UK charity that believe every item, no matter how small, helps to change a life. We manage a number of UK furniture reuse and charity shops, including one in Peterhead, Aberdeenshire.

title: Stranraer Furniture Project Ltd
content: The Community Reuse Shop (Stranraer) is intended to provide a service to the public, so they can donate and reuse a whole range of household items. It is also for people to volunteer so they can learn new skills and share skills. This is for people who have been long term unemployed, so they can gain skills and make personal progress, to increase their prospects in gaining employment.

title: Sustaining Dunbar
content: Since 2008 Sustaining Dunbar has been bringing people together to support new initiatives which aim to make Dunbar and District a better place to live and a more resilient community -making it easier to work locally, cut energy consumption, grow more food locally, safer and easier to walk and cycle and to improve public transport.

title: Swaddle Lanarkshire
content: Swaddle is new social enterprise and charity set up by local mums – we accept your generous donations of good quality used childrens items then sell them in our lovely community shop at affordable prices and use the proceeds to keep the shop running as well as provide free goods and parenting support to local families.

title: Tayside Re-Users
content: Tayside Reusers provide quality, affordable furniture, white goods and household items to people in Tayside, particularly those most in need. Significantly increasing the amount of furniture and other household goods diverted from landfill which benefits local communities, both socially and environmentally. Providing further opportunities for employees, volunteers and placements, particularly those furthest removed from the job market, to acquire more skills, knowledge and confidence.

title: The Edinburgh Remakery
content: The Edinburgh Remakery is a social enterprise, community repair hub and second-hand shop based in the Leith area of Edinburgh. Our vision is to create an alternative to a disposable society by making repair education accessible to all, to build a stronger, waste-free community and support vulnerable people within our city.

title: The Furniture Lodge
content: The Furniture Lodge in Stonehaven encourages people to recycle and reuse, rather than discarding items that could be of benefit to others. Moreover, as well as raising funds by restoring and selling household items, clothing, and electrical goods, we also provide training and employment opportunities for youths and adults.

title: The GRAB Trust
content: The GRAB Trust is a social enterprise that has been providing activities in relation to recycling and environmental  protection in Argyll and Bute for 20 years. We deliver a furniture reuse project in Oban (LORI), a  beach cleaning project and a waste education programme.

title: The Hub G63
content: We are a social enterprise existing to engage and support the local community in sustainable living as part of the wider global environmental movement.

title: The Piano Project
content: The Piano Project is a Glasgow-based social enterprise aiming to reduce social isolation & increase opportunities for people to connect by embedding greater permission to play into the fabric of the city by redistributing piano donations back into the community and facilitating a new appreciation of acoustic pianos in Glasgow & beyond.

title: Total Homes Cooperative
content: Total Homes Co-operative is an environmentally friendly removals and cleaning service, giving housing associations and landlords the opportunity to lower CO2 emissions and contribute positively to Scotlands green agenda. Scotland is already recognised as a global leader in climate action and were thrilled to continue this work in Glasgows housing industry.

title: Transform Community Development
content: Transform Community Development Dundee's aim as an organisation is to meet the needs of vulnerable people by listening to what they say and work with them to find individual solutions to the needs they identify. To achieve this we continue to provide a range of services that we hope really do make a difference. including a furniture reuse service, a fareshare food service and a catering service.

title: Linlithgow Community Development Trust
content: Transition Linlithgow has worked for 10 years taking action on local issues of sustainability and climate change by providing advice and guidance on local food, active travel and energy saving at home. Current projects include a tool library, an active travel hub and a neighbour food project.

title: Transition Stirling
content: Transition Stirling is an environmental charity focusing on improving awareness of, and providing a positive local response to, climate change in and around Stirling. Current initiatives include a tool library, repair café events, a wood reuse scheme, educational workshops and climate conversation sessions.

title: Trust In Fife
content: Trust in Fife is a homelessness support charity involved in managing temporary accommodation hostels and a tenancy share programme. We manage two reuse charity shops to help us raise income to deliver our services across Fife.

title: Eco Art
content: Eco Art are based in Edinburgh and we run fun and creative upcycling classes, workshops and demos for the public and organisations across Scotland. We are a Community Interest Company which means that we put people and planet above profits.  Any profits that we make are used to help us do more good in the world.

title: Upkeep
content: Upkeep, or to give it's full name - Shettleston Community Enterprises is a social enterprise in Glasgow set up by Shettleston Housing Association to deliver property maintenance and estate caretaking services whilst offering jobs and training to local people. They run a small furniture reuse service.

title: Wheatley Housing Group
content: The Wheatley Group is Scotland’s biggest social landlord. They run a "Home Comforts" service that helps tenants who need furniture but can’t afford it. They take unwanted pieces of furniture, clean them and make them as good as new – then pass them to tenants who need it most. It’s a vital service which provides a real lifeline to people struggling to furnish their home.

title: Wood RecyclAbility
content: Wood RecyclAbility was set up in 1997 as a small social enterprise to provide practical work experience for people with additional support needs through working with waste wood. Over the last 21 years the organisation has grown steadily from 2 staff and 6 trainees in a small croft and out buildings to 10 staff and up to 32 trainees each day in a new purpose-built workshop, yard and 5 acres of agricultural land.

title: XS Resources CIC
content: XS Resources are a small social enterprise making the most of our resources by creating value from surplus technology through an IT equipment collection service.

title: Strathcarron Hospice Falkirk Reuse Furniture Store
address: 2 Main Street, Bainsford, Falkirk FK2 7PB, UK
content:
Strathcarron Hospice retail sell on customer donations of clothing, furniture, sports equipment, and general bric a brac via our retail shops across Central Scotland and Forth Valley. We deliver and collect furniture items. Anything we can't sell is recycled. 

The Falkirk Furniture Shop is located near our Retail Distribution Centre and is an ideal place to find preloved furniture looking for a new home. From dining tables to three piece suites there is something for every room in your house. With upcycling as popular as ever, why not make a visit and see what you could find?

title: Edinburgh Tool Library
content: The Edinburgh Tool Library is a community for borrowing tools, sharing skills, and giving support & advice.

title: Inverurie Men's Shed
content: Inverurie and District Men's Shed is a registered charity and is run by the members. The Shed provides not just an escape but a place to meet other men, enjoy social company and either pass on their own skills or learn new ones.

title: Starter Packs Glasgow - Magpie's Nest Reuse Store
content: Starter Packs Glasgow is a charity based in Govan working to alleviate poverty across the city. By providing packs of essential household goods to those moving into a new tenancy, often after homelessness, we can make houses more homely, and help people to sustain their tenancy. We do this through the help and support of our local community, much-needed donations and the many staff and volunteers were lucky to work with.

title: Planet Sutherland
content: Planet Sutherland is a welcoming group with a wide project scope including: recycling, resource efficiency, shopping locally, growing food, education, carbon cafes, film nights and more. We hope to encourage everyone, young and old, to take some action, from small steps to larger projects - and have fun in the process! With so much to do across so many themes, we proactively collaborate with like minded groups and businesses to enhance the effects of our individual efforts to tackle the global warming and environmental issues we are facing today.

title: Baby Steps
content: Baby Steps is a Social Enterprise which employs adults with disabilities, who will be delighted to show customers the range of stock, answer questions, and generally make you feel very welcome. You can always be sure of a friendly face, keen to be of assistance at Baby Steps.

title: Merry Go Round
content:
Merry-go-round is a registered charity and social enterprise supporting local families in three main ways:
A charity shop selling everything baby at low low prices
A partnership programme supplying 100+ agencies in glasgow with free essential children’s goods
Community space to bring families together and reduce isolation

title: Employability Orkney
content: Employability Orkney run a furniture reuse shop in Kirkwall. They accept donations of good-quality furniture, household goods, white goods and clothing. They perform Portable Appliance Testing (PAT) on electrical goods to allow resale. Their showroom sells furniture, household items, white goods and clothing at affordable prices to the Orkney public.

title: Redeem Exchange
content: Redeem Exchange is part of Trade Right International CiC.  We offer an innovative, cost-saving and environmentally friendly solution for empty plastic hand sanitiser and soap product bottles and containers.  Our main objective is to divert plastic waste going to landfill through a simple collect, wash, refill, and return service.   Based in Greenock, our aim is to provide employability training and experience in a safe learning environment for individuals in recovery, with an offending background or who are long term unemployed.  We strive to make a difference by caring for planet, people, pounds, and place in all we do.

title: Bike for Good Glasgow South
content:
Bike for Good are based in Glasgow.

Our Vision is an environment where everyone benefits from riding a bicycle, and our Mission is to enable people in Scotland to cycle as their mode of transport.

We refurbish, repair and teach communities how to maintain a bicycles, improve the environment, teach skills, and improve mental and physical health.

title: Empower Women for Change
address: Saint Enoch Square, Glasgow G1 4DF, UK
content: Empower Women for Change (EWfC) was formed in 2015 in response to the growing needs of the diverse women in Scotland where gaps in support were identified in relation to the empowerment and advancement of women’s rights and active participation in all aspects of civil, economic and political settings.

title: All Together Edinburgh
content: All Together Edinburgh is a social enterprise with charitable status. It was set up in 2010 after recognising that there were very few training opportunities for people with learning disabilities to learn skills that would help them work within the retail/charity retailing sector or customer facing environment.

title: Repair Stop
content: The Repair Stop in Govanhill, is an affordable fixing service for computers, phones, clothes, bags, lamps and small upholstery and electrical items.

title: Budding Engineers CIC
content: We offer services to schools, groups and individuals around technology, design and circular economy. We are looking to encourage and inspire STEAM into children by Introducing them to the world of 3D Design and Digital Technology using Computer Aided Design.

title: Community Gift Exchange
content: The Community Gift Exchange SCIO is a registered Scottish Charity helping to generate flourishing communities in Ayrshire. The CGX Restoration Shop in Ayr is not only a showroom of second hand goods it also has a backroom Repair and Restore Centre.

title: Moray Reach Out
content: Moray Reach Out is a charity that has several social enterprises around the Moray that gives training and work experience to vulnerable adults: Moray Reach Out runs three businesses including Waste Watchers, Buckie Yarns and In Stitches. Each business provides training and work experience for vulnerable adults in the Moray area.

title: Sea The Change
content: Sea the Change is a social enterprise with the vision to create an environmentally friendly world by empowering people to make positive changes in attitudes and behaviours which can have a long-lasting impact in our community and the environment.

title: Montrose Men's Shed
content: Anything you can imagine doing can be done within Montrose Men's Shed. Woodworking can of-course be done, as can Metal Working, Glass Blowing, Computer Skills, Electrical and Mechanical projects, basic Automotive refurbishment and Repair right down to board games and sewing. Currently the shed comprises of the Main Workshop, this is a multi purpose space setup for general activities including woodworking. The Shed can also be a place to start a new hobby or sport.

title: Grassmarket Community Project
content: Grassmarket Furniture (formerly GRoW) started in 2006 and is one of the social enterprises in the Grassmarket Community Project. The workshop is open across four days per week and has about six regular volunteers on each day. They transform unwanted church pews and other wood into beautiful, bespoke pieces of furniture and home furnishings.

title: Berwickshire SWAP
content: We run swap events in Berwickshire and the surrounding areas, focusing mainly on children’s clothes. Leftover clothes are stored for the next swap. We have just started packaging these stored clothes into emergency clothing parcels available on referral from health visitors, schools, social work etc. We are in the process of starting a cloth nappy library, where people can borrow a variety of different cloth nappies for a few weeks before they decide if cloth nappies are for them.

title: WASaBED
content: Our Social Enterprise recycles retired bedlinen into sustainable handmade bespoke Beach Clean Bags. We will reduce the amount of retired bedlinen going into landfill by bringing it into the circular economy and reusing it for environmental benefits. Retired bedlinen can be made into a range of products including our handmade Beach Clean Bags. We intend to create rural jobs for sewers who can fabricate useful items from retired bedlinen.

title: Sustainable Kirriemuir
content: Sustainable Kirriemuir formed in 2019 when a community of people decided to try and live well without costing the Earth.

title: Angus Up-Cycling Project
content: The Angus Up-Cycling project takes in small pieces of furniture that members of the public no longer require and upcycle them and sell them onto those in need, at low/affordable prices. We work with the young people from the local secondary school who are disengaged from education.

title: The Bike Station Perth
content: The Bike Station Perth's aim is to help people start and keep cycling and that begins with the bicycle. Their shop stocks everything you'll need to keep your bike in perfect condition. With the emphasis on old parts reclaimed from donated bikes, there is no cheaper way of looking after your bike whilst keeping waste out of landfill.

title: A Positive Start CIC
content:
A Positive Start CIC offers counselling, training and development, providing free and low-cost holistic services to improve mental health, offering concessions for people on low and no incomes, and free for anyone who is furloughed due to Covid. 

Prewear is a project by A Positive Start incorporating our other passion which is sustainability. Prewear is an online charity store, redirecting unwanted fashion from landfill, recycling and rehoming at affordable prices. Funds raised are reinvested to support mental wellbeing in the community.

title: Cafe Recharge CIC
content: We aim to reduce the gap between food poverty and food waste by using unsold food from supermarkets to serve in a Pay What You Can Cafe in Galashiels.

title: Ullapool Unpacked CIC
content: Ullapool Unpacked C.I.C. is going to be a Zero Waste shop and Community Interest Company. Primarily selling unpackaged goods in bulk.

title: Home-Start Clackmannanshire
address: Alloa Business Centre, Whins Road, Alloa, UK
content: Home-Start Clackmannanshire have been supporting families through-out local communities across Clackmannanshire since 1988. We manage a charity shop and starter pack project.

title: Nest Creative Spaces CIC
content:
Nest Creative Spaces is a Community Interest Company and non-profit Social Enterprise by
volunteers. We have a craft remnant shop that receives donations of part used arts & crafts materials that we resell thus keeping them out of landfill. Our new project, Thrift n Thrive aims to encourage and support reuse of these materials by creating imagination kits for your up-cyclers to purchase and craft kits for use in a series of reuse and recycling workshops and for sale.

title: Glasgow Tool Library
content: The Glasgow Tool Library (GTL) works just like a normal library, but instead of sharing books, we share tools. Established in 2017, the tool library is a community-led social enterprise and collective that promotes sharing, collaboration, and learning as forms of resistance, empowerment, and resilience.

title: Bridge of Don and District Men's Shed
address: Corunna Road, Bridge of Don, Aberdeen, UK
content: We are a registered charity looking to generate a Men's Shed in the Bridge of Don area of Aberdeen which will be volunteer run and member led.

title: Music Broth
content: Music Broth is a Glasgow-based social enterprise that has established a musical instrument and equipment sharing library. The wider vision is to build a connected music community throughout Glasgow and beyond based on the sharing of instruments and experiences.

title: Aberdeen Climate Action
address: Hillview Terrace, Cults, Aberdeen AB15 9HJ, UK
content: We are a volunteer-run organisation that aims to inform and prompt action on climate change and sustainable practices in the North East of Scotland through awareness raising, education, partnerships and support.

title: Fed Up Community Cafe
content: The Fed Up Community Café in Stranraer helps to tackle poverty and social isolation by creating a safe café space to bring people together and offer help & advice. This includes looking at food waste and food poverty issues.

title: Reset Scenery CIC
content: Reset Scenery (CIC) is a Glasgow based, not for profit company dedicated to providing the Scottish creative arts sector with an environmentally responsible and economical alternative to landfill for its unwanted scenery, props & furniture.

title: Stitch the Gap CIC
content: We are a start-up Social Enterprise Company who are passionate about bridging the sewing machine skills gap so that this valuable, life-long skill is not lost in our generation. We are passionate about our environment and believe that we can only affect environmental change by equipping people with the skills and knowledge to do this. Our beginner sewing sessions are a small step in the direction to learning how to up-cycle, re-purpose and repair clothes and textiles.

title: Ostrero
content: Ostrero works to grow the Circular Economy in Scotland through mindset change and education. We raise awareness of what the Circular Economy is and how it is vitally important to Scotland’s economic and environmental wellbeing.

title: Ullapool Community Trust
content: UCT aims to develop and deliver projects that offer social, economic and environmental benefits to the community and local people in and around Ullapool.

title: Plastic@Bay CIC
content: Plastics@Bay became a Community Interest Company in January 2018 in order to help fight plastic pollution around Durness and all over Scotland with beach patrols and litter picks.

title: The General Store Selkirk
content: We are a community repair shop based in Selkirk. If you can bring it in, we’ll take a look. No fix no fee. Supporting local making. Loving pre-loved. Workshops. Make more of what we already have. Not for profit, for the community. Championing Selkirk.

title: Lochee Community Group
content: Lochee Pop up Shop is a low cost home improvement group, helping local people improve their homes so they can be happy there. in 2020, we created and opened the Community warehouse, a place for people to donate so as to avoid land fill and a place to obtain low cost goods.

title: One Planet Forth Valley
content: One Planet Forth Valley is a Central Scotland Regional Equality Council project funded by the Scottish Government’s Climate Challenge Fund. CSREC was awarded the funding to run the One Planet Forth Valley Project to help local minority communities tackle climate change.

title: Arran Repair Cafe
content: A new repair cafe and tool library project for Arran.

title: Clachworks
content: Clachworks is a new social enterprise that plans to open a socially inclusive space for making and remaking in Inverness. We believe that the tools, skills and resources needed to create and repair things shouldn’t cost the earth, and should be accessible to all. As such, we have plans to open a tool library, open-access workshop space, community garden and cafe.
